verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> which Habakkuk<WH2265> the prophet<WH5030> did see<WH2372>.
O Lord<WH3068>, how long shall I cry<WH7768>, and you will not hear<WH8085>! even cry out<WH2199> unto you of violence<WH2555>, and you will not save<WH3467>!

Why do you show<WH7200> me iniquity<WH205>, and cause me to behold<WH5027> grievance<WH5999>? for spoiling<WH7701> and violence<WH2555> are before me<WH5375>: and there are that raise up strife<WH7379> and contention<WH4066>.

Therefore the law<WH8451> is feeble<WH6313>, and judgment<WH4941> does never<WH5331> go forth<WH3318>: for the wicked<WH7563> do compass<WH3803> about the righteous<WH6662>; therefore wrong<WH6127> judgment<WH4941> proceeds<WH3318>.

Behold<WH7200> among the heathen<WH1471>, and regard<WH5027>, and wonder<WH8539> marvelously<WH8539>: for I will work<WH6466> a work<WH6467> in your days<WH3117>, which you will not believe<WH539>, though it be told you<WH5608>.

For<WH6965>, behold, I raise up the Chaldeans<WH3778>, that bitter<WH4751> and hasty<WH4116> nation<WH1471>, which shall march<WH1980> through the breadth<WH4800> of the land<WH776>, to possess<WH3423> the dwellingplaces that are not theirs<WH4908>.
They are terrible<WH366> and dreadful<WH3372>: their judgment<WH4941> and their dignity<WH7613> shall proceed of themselves<WH3318>.

Their horses<WH5483> also are swifter<WH7043> than the leopards<WH5246>, and are more fierce<WH2300> than the evening<WH6153> wolves<WH2061>: and their horsemen<WH6571> shall spread<WH6335> themselves<WH6571>, and their horsemen shall come<WH935> from far<WH7350>; they shall fly<WH5774> as the eagle<WH5404> that hastens<WH2363> to eat<WH398>.
They shall come<WH935> all for violence<WH2555>: their faces<WH6440> shall sup up<WH4041> as the east wind<WH6921>, and they shall gather<WH622> the captivity<WH7628> as the sand<WH2344>.

And they shall scoff<WH7046> at the kings<WH4428>, and the princes<WH7336> shall be a scorn<WH4890> unto them<WH7832>: they shall deride every strong hold<WH4013>; for they shall heap<WH6651> dust<WH6083>, and take it<WH3920>.
Then shall his mind<WH7307> change<WH2498>, and he shall pass over<WH5674>, and offend<WH816>, imputing this<WH2098> his power<WH3581> unto his god<WH433>.

Are you not from everlasting<WH6924>, O Lord<WH3068> my God<WH430>, my Holy One<WH6918>? we shall not die<WH4191>. O Lord<WH3068>, you have ordained<WH7760> them for judgment<WH4941>; and<WH6697>, O mighty God, you have established<WH3245> them for correction<WH3198>.

You are of purer<WH2889> eyes<WH5869> than to behold<WH7200> evil<WH7451>, and can<WH3201> not look<WH5027> on iniquity<WH5999>: therefore look<WH5027> you upon them that deal treacherously<WH898>, and hold your tongue<WH2790> when the wicked<WH7563> devours<WH1104> the man that is more righteous than he<WH6662>?
And make<WH6213> men<WH120> as the fish<WH1709> of the sea<WH3220>, as the creeping things<WH7431>, that have no ruler over them<WH4910>?

They take up<WH5927> all of them with the hook<WH2443>, they catch<WH1641> them in their trap<WH2764>, and gather<WH622> them in their dragnet<WH4365>: therefore they rejoice<WH8055> and are glad<WH1523>.

Therefore they sacrifice<WH2076> unto their trap<WH2764>, and burn incense<WH6999> unto their dragnet<WH4365>; because by them<WH1992> their portion<WH2506> is fat<WH8082>, and their food<WH3978> plentiful<WH1277>.
Shall they therefore empty<WH7324> their net<WH2764>, and not spare<WH2550> continually<WH8548> to kill<WH2026> the nations<WH1471>?
